bibl.title: Toponomastic Mal in P. Nessana 22 [sic, lire: 82] and P. Petra Inv. 10 (Papyrus Petra Khaled & Suha Shoman).
bibl.note: P. Petra Inv. 10 (to be published in the near future) contains a wealth of Semitic, for the most part Arabic, toponyms and names of houses and parts of houses written in Greek letters (sixth century). Thanks to a parallel in line 4 of P. Nessana III, 82, it was possible to recognize in line 150 of P. Petra Inv. 10 the first element of a toponym as being mal 'property'.
bibl.seg: 141.4 P. Petra Inv. 10 145.4 P. Nessana III, 82
DANIEL Robert Walter, Toponomastic Mal in P. Nessana 22 [sic, lire: 82] and P. Petra Inv. 10 (Papyrus Petra Khaled & Suha Shoman).

P. Petra Inv. 10 (to be published in the near future) contains a wealth of Semitic, for the most part Arabic, toponyms and names of houses and parts of houses written in Greek letters (sixth century). Thanks to a parallel in line 4 of P. Nessana III, 82, it was possible to recognize in line 150 of P. Petra Inv. 10 the first element of a toponym as being mal 'property'.
